plugins.name: Detach Master
plugins.description:
Detach Master is a Figma plugin that allows you to quickly detach various properties within a selected frame. It simplifies the editing process by providing selective detachment options, making design modifications more efficient.


Usage

1. Select a frame or area where you want to detach elements

2. Choose the specific detach options:

  1. Detach Instances
  2. Detach Text Styles
  3. Detach Color Styles
  4. Detach Effect Styles
  5. Detach Grid Styles
  6. Detach Variables
  7. Remove Auto-layout
  8. Remove Hidden Layers

3. Press the Detach button to apply the selected actions.



Do you have any feedback?


If you have any inquiries, feel free to contact us anytime at designbasekorea@gmail.com.


Website: https://designbase.co.kr/

YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/designbase

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/designbasekorea/

121979.release_notes:
We‚Äôre excited to introduce Detach Master, a powerful update that enhances your Figma workflow by providing granular control over component detachment.

‚ú® New Features
Now, you can selectively detach various elements within a selected frame, making it easier than ever to modify and refine your designs.

Detach Instances ‚Üí Convert instance components into regular layers.
Detach Text Styles ‚Üí Remove linked text styles while preserving content.
Detach Color Styles ‚Üí Unlink applied color styles for custom adjustments.
Detach Effect Styles ‚Üí Convert effect styles into editable properties.
Detach Grid Styles ‚Üí Break away from predefined grid structures.
Detach Variables ‚Üí Unlink all variable-based properties.
Remove Auto-layout ‚Üí Convert auto-layout frames into free-positioned layers.
Remove Hidden Layers ‚Üí Clean up your design by automatically removing hidden elements.
üõ†Ô∏è Improvements
Enhanced performance for handling large-scale files.
More intuitive UI/UX for selecting detachment options.
Faster detachment process for smoother workflow.

plugins.name: Pablo
plugins.description:
Are you a UI/UX Designer at a fast-paced startup?


If so, like me, you've likely been asked the same question in interviews time and time again: "What do you suck at?" My answer? UX Writing.


With limited time and resources, it's often difficult to create engaging, concise copy that gives all the information a user needs in as fewer words as possible. I needed a solution ‚Äî something that would generate intelligent, contextual copy at the click of a button. That's why I turned to AI.


Introducing Pablo ‚Äî the perfect way to generate informative and instructional copy for your designs. With Pablo, you can craft the perfect copy with the option to generate multiple variations until it's just right.


So, give it a go FOR FREE today and see for yourself how much it speeds up your workflow!

plugins.name: Codia AI VectorMagic Pro: Image to Full-Color Vector/PNG to SVG
plugins.description:
Transform your bitmap images into stunning, scalable vector graphics with the click of a button. Codia AI VectorMagic leverages advanced AI to offer a seamless transition from pixelated images to crisp, clean vectors. Perfect for designers, illustrators, and anyone looking to elevate their digital graphics.


How It Works


- PICK: Drag and drop any JPEG or PNG into the plugin. Starting with a pixel-based image, prepare to watch the magic happen.

- PROCESS: Our AI dives deep, converting your image into geometric shapes for flawless scalability. Say goodbye to blurs and hello to precision.

- DOWNLOAD: Preview the transformation, tweak if necessary, and download in SVG or PNG. Ready for any project.


Full Featured


- AI Vector Engine: Powered by the latest AI technology, combining deep learning with classical algorithms for unparalleled vectorization.

- Vector Graph: Unique computational geometry for automated edits and optimizations, achieving results beyond conventional methods.

- Full Shape Fitting & Curve Support: From Bezier curves to complex shapes, our technology ensures perfect fit and consistency.

- Clean Corners & High Performance: Meticulously crafted corners and high-speed processing for natural-looking vectors without waiting.

- Sub-Pixel Precision & Full Automation: Capturing the finest details automatically, requiring no manual input for a hassle-free experience.

- Versatile Image Types & Pre-Crop Feature: Ideal for logos, sketches, and even photographs. Maximize quality with smart cropping.

- Full Color & Transparency: Embrace the full spectrum of 32-bit color, including transparency for vibrant, true-to-life vectors.


Elevate your design workflow with Codia AI VectorMagic. Experience the future of vectorization today and bring unparalleled clarity and scalability to your digital art.

accepted.description: Anything to Design, Anything to Code.

plugins.tagline: Seamlessly convert Pixel Images/JPG/PNG to Full-Color Vector Graphics with AI automation

plugins.name: FigNotion
plugins.description:
FigNotion is a simple plugin to add your FigJam sticky notes to a Notion database.


Move ideas into action by syncing your FigJam sticky notes with a database in Notion. This allows you to sort, filter, group, and help your team move forward. Save time by connecting Figjam to Notion using this plugin, removing the need to switch between tabs or copying/pasting data between apps.


What‚Äôs included:

  1. Export FigJam sticky notes into a Notion database.


Use cases

You can use this plugin whenever you‚Äôre working between FigJam boards and Notion databases. We have identified the following use cases to save time and help teams get back to work:


  1. Meetings: Sync your team‚Äôs actions or tasks from meetings or retrospectives back into a Notion task database.
  2. Research: Add your user research insights into a research repository database inside of Notion.
  3. Planning: Collaborate and plan your roadmaps visually in FigJam and sync them back into a structure Notion database during OKR Planning


Feature Requests

You can request a new feature, suggest an improvement or file a bug here:


+ New Feature Request


We welcome you to share any additional use cases you've identified in the comments!

accepted.name: Martin Merschroth
accepted.description: Early to the party, but my designs are the latest.

plugins.tagline: Export sticky notes from FigJam into Notion Databases

plugins.name: Node Decoder
plugins.description:
Node Decoder generates plugin or widget source code from any Figma design as Javascript and JSX. Useful for avoiding the need to code visual assets manually when developing plugins.


Generating source code


  1. Select one or more (ideally top level) layers/nodes
  2. Run the command Node Decoder
  3. Copy the generated source code
  4. Click the toggle to flip between plugin and widget code.


Previewing code


  1. Press the play icon to run the currently generated code


Plugin code


  • Selection should ideally be made at the top level
  • Doesn't support checking for custom fonts yet
  • Doesn't support images yet
  • Some frames which use Auto Layout may be slightly off because of when properties are applied


Features


  • Generates most of the source code needed to create, frames, shapes, vectors, text, groups, boolean operations, components and component sets
  • Provides syntax highlighted code which you can copy to use in your own plugin
  • Detects when text layers are present and provides a function for loading fonts before setting text properties
  • Automatically creates components needed for selection if not selected by the user
  • Automatically creates paint, effect, grid and text styles if used by nodes
  • Intelligently generates overrides for instance nodes


Widget code


  • Vectors should be in frames and have an export setting of SVG.
  • It's better to use frames than groups (for now)
  • Doesn't support images yet
  • Some nodes do not exist as React components are not supported in widget code


If you encounter any issues or have any feedback, please raise an issue at https://github.com/limitlessloop/figma-node-decoder


JavaScript API (Alpha)


An alpha version of a JavaScript API is now available to try in your own plugins. Convert any node to a string that can be recreated later.


https://github.com/limitlessloop/figma-node-decoder/tree/javascript-api

accepted.name: Gavin McFarland
accepted.description: Freelance Designer and Developer who loves making things

plugins.tagline: Generate plugin and widget source code based on Figma designs

plugins.name: Continuous Design - Run CI from Figma
plugins.description:
Continuous Design is a Figma plugin that lets you run GitHub Actions, Bitbucket Pipelines, and Azure DevOps Pipelines from Figma.


If you want to practice "continuous design" using Figma and a modern development toolchain, it may be time to start deploying design changes straight from Figma!


Prerequisites

You will need:

  • An account with your provider
  • A pre-existing repository with your provider
  • A pre-existing CI workflow:
  • For a GitHub Actions reference, see my repo github-ci-demo. Note that you have to allow Actions to be run in the repo for this to work! Please also see how the workflow and  workflow_dispatch is defined to better understand your setup needs.
  • For a GitLab reference, see my repo gitlab-ci-demo.
  • For a Bitbucket Pipelines reference, see my repo bitbucket-ci-demo.
  • For an Azure DevOps Pipelines reference, see my repo azure-devops-ci-demo.
  • A means of authentication:
  • GitHub: A personal access token (with "repo" scope"). You can create one at https://github.com/settings/tokens. If you are stuck, follow the instructions at GitHub.
  • Bitbucket: An application password. You can create one at https://bitbucket.org/account/settings/app-passwords/. More instructions here.
  • Azure: A personal access token. Instructions here.


Permissions and data collection

Depending on your provider, you will need either a personal access token or an application password. These are are the accepted ways of handling plugins and other external tooling in the GitHub/Bitbucket/Azure DevOps contexts.


The plugin itself never sends this information anywhere other than to call the respective provider APIs.


You can however decide to store the state of all fields privately within Figma. Doing so stores the current state (including the PAT value) in Figma's contained asyncStorage (essentially a sandboxed localStorage).


Using the plugin

Given that you have the prerequisites under control, it's just a matter of filling out the fields.


The strictly necessary fields to get a success response are:

- Personal access token/Application password: Your token or password from GitHub/Bitbucket/Azure.

- User name: Your user name.

- Repository name: Your repository name as it appears in a typical URL.

- Workflow name [GitHub only: Has to be specified in the style of `filename.yml`. Defaults to `main.yml`.

- Organization name [Bitbucket only]: Your organization's name (might also be called "workspace").

- Definition ID [Azure only]: The seemingly random (?) ID that each pipeline receives. The easiest way to get it is to navigate to your pipeline in the Azure DevOps web console and check the URL bar which should look like: `https://dev.azure.com/YOUR_USER/YOUR_PROJECT/_build?definitionId=16`.

- Branch: Should be same as the branch you want to trigger. Defaults to `main`.


The optional fields are:

- Message: Can be used to provide the CI workflow some context on what's changed.

- Version: Can be used to provide the CI workflow information on a version. See the below example for how this can be used with‚Äîfor example‚ÄîFigmagic to pull data from a given version of your Figma document.


You will receive a popup/alert that informs you that the workflow is starting/failing.

plugins.name: Phrase TMS
plugins.description:
At Phrase, we‚Äôre transforming language technology, opening the door to global business so you can reach more people, make deeper connections, and drive growth.

Our comprehensive suite of translation tools is intuitive to use and simple to integrate so you can focus on forming deeper connections with people across cultures.

 

Figma + Phrase TMS

Bring design and localization closer together with the Phrase TMS integration for Figma.

 

Seamless localization

 There‚Äôs no need to leave your Figma account to create translation projects in Phrase TMS. Send your designs for translation in just a few clicks, then seamlessly pull translations from Phrase TMS back to Figma when complete.

 

Easily test localized designs

Use the pseudo-translate feature to validate translations in the design phase. Pseudotranslation simulates what your localized text will look like, allowing designers to get an early indication of how translations fit the design, reducing feedback loops. 

 

Save time and money

Translation memories within Phrase TMS will automatically store all past translations and allow you to reuse them wherever possible, making for faster, cheaper, and more consistent localization. Updating copy in Figma? Sync updated translations to translation memories in Phrase TMS, without leaving Figma. 

 

Leverage state of the art machine translation

Speed up the localization process, without sacrificing quality. Phrase TMS integrates with over 30 MT engines and automatically selects the optimal MT engine for every content piece.

 

Set up

The plugin requires Phrase TMS Ultimate or Enterprise plan. Get in touch with Sales for licensing questions. 

 

Installing the plugin is quick and easy. Visit the Phrase TMS Figma Plugin page for more information.

accepted.description: The fastest and easiest way possible to start translating your Figma designs. Phrase is a translation management solution built with the whole team in mind.

plugins.name: @sposhe/voronoi
plugins.description:
Voronoi

Generate a Voronoi diagram from a single frame containing one or more ellipses.


How To Use

  1. Create a frame
  2. Add ellipses to the frame (the size of the ellipses doesn't matter‚Äîjust make sure they're visible)
  3. Select the frame
  4. Run the plugin with the frame selected
  5. A new frame containing vector Voronoi cells is non-destructively generated beside the source frame


How It Works

The plugin uses the X and Y position of the ellipses as the input nodes for creating the Voronoi cells. The cell bounds are calculated using the d3-delaunay library. The plugin creates a new frame beside the source frame, and draws each cell into it as a vector shape.
plugins.tagline: Generate a Voronoi diagram from a single frame containing one or more ellipses.

plugins.name: Variables Translator
plugins.description:
Variables Translator allows you to translate your text content stored in a collection, thanks to the latest feature: Variables. The plugin will enable you to create a new mode containing the translation of each of your String variables into the language of your choice.


How to start?

After downloading the plugin, create a collection to store your text content, including as many string variables as necessary. For example, if you're managing the content of a modal, create variables such as "Modal/title," "Modal/subtitle," and "Modal/cta.‚Äù


Learn more about Variables ‚ÜóÔ∏é


How to use the plugin?

Launch the plugin, and you'll see 3 fields:

1. Collection to Translate

2. Input Language

3. Output Language


You can use the Collection to Translate field to select the collection containing the content you want to translate. Note that only collections with String type variables will be displayed.


The Input Language field allows you to choose the starting language of your content. This will always be the first Mode created in your collection.


Finally, the Output Language field lets you select the language in which you want to translate your content. A new Mode will be created and named according to the chosen language.

plugins.name: Kascade
plugins.description:
Generate design system foundations ‚Äì Quickly identify style systems with the Kascade Chrome extension and export style references into Figma.


Find all major type and color style properties at once, right alongside the webpage itself ‚Äì no more digging around in dev tools!



Import with Kascade ‚Äì be the style hero.


Effortless and useful style inspection imports‚Ä®

This plugin is the companion import plugin for the Kascade Chrome extension. Kascade instantly inspects styles on web pages and gets the answers you need quickly. All without diving into code.


This plugin helps you quickly import style inspections from Kascade and formats them into a handy style reference set.


No matter what you need to do, Kascade‚Äôs style reference sets get you on your way fast.

  • Perform quick style inspections and compare your findings.
  • Get fast baseline styles for a new project or simply find outliers in your pre-release builds.


How it works


FREE imports

This plugin is free to use. The Kascade Chrome extension is a paid subscription with a 7-day free trial.


To import from the Kascade Chrome extension‚Ä®

When in the Kascade Chrome extension press ‚ÄòExport To Figma‚Äô. Click the 'Copy JSON for Figma' button below, then paste this into the Figma plugin to generate these styles üòÑ.‚Ä®The JSON you have copied from The Chrome extension will run a code check and when the code is processed the plugin will generate a new layer in your Figma file and create the Style reference set based on the styles exported from the Chrome extension.


Font replacement

The import of type styles will require in some situations you either follow the link to a suitable Type foundry that provides the relevant Font found in the live site or that you choose to import the styles and use the nearest font in the font stack that you have available on your system.


And many more features to come. Watch this space.


Troubleshooting and Feedback

While we think we have everything covered there may be something we need to know about and fix. If you have any feedback or need some support with an issue using our app please let us know



Made with ‚ù§Ô∏è by Kascade

Aotearoa | New Zealand Visit us: kascade.design
plugins.tagline: Inspect web pages and bring the style system into Figma.

plugins.name: Comment Exporter
plugins.description:
Streamline your design collaboration by exporting all Figma comments into a CSV file with a single click. Whether you're conducting design reviews, gathering feedback, or managing content updates, this plugin makes it easy to organise and manage comments outside of Figma.


How to Use:

1. For First-Time Users:

- Navigate to your Figma Account Settings.

- Under Personal Access Tokens. click on Generate New Token.

- Copy the token provided by Figma.

- Open the plugin and paste the token when prompted.

- Once you‚Äôve entered the token, simply click the export button to download all comments as a CSV file.


2. For Returning Users:

- The plugin securely saves your token, so the next time you use it, you can directly export comments with just one click‚Äîno need to re-enter the token.


Use Cases:


- Design Reviews: Keep a record of design feedback for team retrospectives or audits.

- Client Presentations: Share feedback and comments with clients in a clean, organized format.

- Content Management: Many clients provide content updates via Figma comments‚Äîeasily export those comments to track and implement content changes efficiently.

- Documentation: Export comments to create comprehensive design documentation and track feedback over time.

- Project Management: Integrate feedback into project management tools like Notion, Jira, or Confluence using the exported CSV.
plugins.tagline: Export all Figma comments to CSV with just one click
